channel.title: Help
channel.description: I followed everything all the guides said and nothing worked. my server was running but i cant get into it. can anyone just tell me what im doing wrong? :(

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Ace52 Ace52
item.description:
@Ace52 wrote:

ok i think there is something else wrong with it because i have done that a lot and it always says cannot connect. do u want to see the compile and runeserver codes? i think those might be the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Divine-Devil Divine-Devil
item.description:
@Divine-Devil wrote:

Ok, if you downloaded a source open up the folder and look for run.bat, then run mopar’s client. put in localhost, or 127.0.0.1 for your I.P

If you did not download the source, just run moparscape client and put in 127.0.0.1 or localhost.

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Ace52 Ace52
item.description:
@Ace52 wrote:

im sorry im not that smart. but how do i get on to my server? do i enter my ip in? or the no-ip.info thing?

Read full topic

item.title: Help
item.dc:creator: @Divine-Devil Divine-Devil
item.description:
@Divine-Devil wrote:

Did you click run.bat THEN…click on the mopar client? or vise versa?

Your suppose to click run.bat, Should say it started up successfully then you run the mopar client. See if that works.

No it doesn’t you should be able to get on without portforwarding

Read full topic
